item.title: Weird commands
item.dc:creator: @silabmods silabmods
item.description:
@silabmods wrote:

hiyascape has items with ID’s made from 5 numbers, so he need something like this:
::pickup 00995 999
^CMD ^Item ^amount
And the thing with getting both items and error is kinda weird, wich error it shows? i think i saw there to messages in case of error.
By the way wen i try the ::tele cmd i recieve an idiot error ( like he gets with ::pickup ) that says something like this:
try ::tele #####,#####
but i get teleported where i want … weird XD but funny same time

Read full topic

item.title: Weird commands
item.dc:creator: @Redslash Redslash
item.description:
@Redslash wrote:

When I do the pickup and pick command (::pickup + item + amount) It says an error; that I typed the code wrong (Wich i didn’t)
But the weird thing is, that I get the item I wanted…(Even with the error message)

My pickup command: (Item and pick commands are the same as my pickup command, i just renamed pickup to: item and pick)

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && (playerRights >= 2)) { try { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7,12)); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13)); if (newItemID <= 30000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("That Item Doesn't Exist"); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Cmon Type IT AGIAN ! "); } }
This may help also: I’m using Galkons Anarchy v2. (But it also showed the same thing in silabsoft)

Is there any way to fix this?
(My source is Hiyascape v2)

Thanks,
Redslash

Read full topic
